<compliance_report>
    <compliance_issues>
        <issue priority="MATERIAL" confidence="95">
            <title>Missing Administrative Regulation for Implementation Procedures</title>
            <description>California Education Code requires districts that provide health services to establish detailed procedures for implementation. The Board Policy establishes the framework but lacks the specific procedural requirements mandated by law, including emergency procedures, medication administration protocols, health screening procedures, and staff qualification requirements.</description>
            <missing_from>AR</missing_from>

            <legal_basis>
                <california_code>
                    <citation>Education Code Section 49423</citation>
                    <text>The governing board of any school district may employ persons licensed as registered nurses... and shall adopt policies for the administration of prescribed medication to pupils.</citation>
                </california_code>
            </legal_basis>

            <required_language>
                <text>Administrative regulation must include: procedures for medication administration, emergency response protocols, health screening procedures, staff training requirements, documentation and record-keeping procedures, and coordination with emergency services.</text>
            </required_language>

            <recommended_placement>AR</recommended_placement>
        </issue>

        <issue priority="MATERIAL" confidence="90">
            <title>Missing Specific Medication Administration Procedures</title>
            <description>Education Code requires specific procedures for administering medication to students, including training requirements for staff, storage protocols, documentation requirements, and emergency procedures. These detailed procedures are not present in either document.</description>
            <missing_from>BOTH</missing_from>

            <legal_basis>
                <california_code>
                    <citation>Education Code Section 49423</citation>
                    <text>School districts shall adopt policies for the administration of prescribed medication to pupils during regular school hours.</citation>
                </california_code>
            </legal_basis>

            <required_language>
                <text>Procedures must specify: (1) Written request requirements from parent/guardian and physician, (2) Medication storage and security protocols, (3) Staff training and authorization procedures, (4) Documentation and record-keeping requirements, (5) Emergency response procedures for adverse reactions.</text>
            </required_language>

            <recommended_placement>AR</recommended_placement>
        </issue>

        <issue priority="MATERIAL" confidence="85">
            <title>Missing Emergency Medical Care Procedures</title>
            <description>Districts must establish specific procedures for handling medical emergencies, including protocols for calling emergency services, parent notification, and staff responsibilities. These critical safety procedures are absent from both documents.</description>
            <missing_from>BOTH</missing_from>

            <legal_basis>
                <california_code>
                    <citation>Education Code Section 49407</citation>
                    <text>Any employee of a school district who reasonably believes that a pupil is suffering from a medical emergency shall call the emergency 911 telephone number and shall immediately notify the school nurse, if available, and an administrator.</text>
                </california_code>
            </legal_basis>

            <required_language>
                <text>Procedures must include: (1) Steps for identifying medical emergencies, (2) Protocol for calling 911, (3) Immediate notification procedures for school nurse and administrator, (4) Parent/guardian notification requirements, (5) Documentation procedures for emergency incidents.</text>
            </required_language>

            <recommended_placement>AR</recommended_placement>
        </issue>

        <issue priority="MATERIAL" confidence="80">
            <title>Missing Health Screening and Immunization Procedures</title>
            <description>California law requires specific procedures for conducting health screenings and managing immunization requirements. The policy lacks detailed implementation procedures for these mandatory health requirements.</description>
            <missing_from>AR</missing_from>

            <legal_basis>
                <california_code>
                    <citation>Education Code Section 49451</citation>
                    <text>The governing board of any school district shall provide for the conduct of health screenings of pupils in elementary schools to detect vision, hearing, and other physical defects that would affect the pupil's ability to learn.</text>
                </california_code>
            </legal_basis>

            <required_language>
                <text>Procedures must specify: (1) Schedule and frequency of required health screenings, (2) Qualified personnel requirements for conducting screenings, (3) Parent notification procedures for screening results, (4) Follow-up procedures for identified health issues, (5) Record-keeping and reporting requirements.</text>
            </required_language>

            <recommended_placement>AR</recommended_placement>
        </issue>

        <issue priority="MINOR" confidence="75">
            <title>Missing Specific FERPA Compliance Procedures for Health Records</title>
            <description>While the policy mentions maintaining confidentiality "in accordance with law," it lacks specific procedures for FERPA compliance regarding health records, including access limitations and disclosure procedures.</description>
            <missing_from>AR</missing_from>

            <legal_basis>
                <california_code>
                    <citation>Education Code Section 49076</citation>
                    <text>Each school district shall inform parents and guardians of pupils and eligible pupils of their rights under this article and shall make available upon request a copy of the policies and procedures adopted pursuant to this article.</text>
                </california_code>
            </legal_basis>

            <required_language>
                <text>Procedures should specify: (1) Who may access student health records, (2) Procedures for parent/guardian access to records, (3) Limitations on disclosure of health information, (4) Procedures for obtaining consent for disclosure when required.</text>
            </required_language>

            <recommended_placement>AR</recommended_placement>
        </issue>
    </compliance_issues>
</compliance_report>
